column2: qŭóniam bonus
column3: qŭóniam in sáĕculum misericórdia ejus. ^ Give praise to the Lord
column5: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: qŭóniam in sáĕculum misericórdia ejus. ^ Let Israel now say
column3: that he is good
column4: that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: qŭóniam in sáĕculum misericórdia ejus. ^ Let the house of Aaron now say
column3: that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: qŭóniam in sáĕculum misericórdia ejus. ^ Let them that fear the Lord now say
column3: that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: et exaŭdívit me in latitúdinem Dòminus. ^ In my trouble I called upon the Lord
column3: and the Lord hearkened me into broadness.

column1: 6 ^ Dòminus mìhi adjútor~; non timébo qŭid fáciat mìhi hòmo. ^ The Lord is my helper~; I will not fear what man can do unto me.

column2: et ego despìciam inimícos meos. ^ The Lord is my helper
column3: and I will look over my enemies.

column2: qŭam confídere in hòmine. ^ It is good to confide in the Lord
column3: rather than to have confidence in man.

column2: qŭam speráre in princìpibus. ^ It is good to trust in the Lord
column3: rather than to trust in princes.

column2: et in nómine Dòmini qŭia ultus sùm in eos. ^ All nations compassed me about
column3: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

column2: et in nómine Dòmini qŭia ultus sùm in eos. ^ Surrounding me they compassed me about
column3: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

column2: et exarsérunt sicut ìgnis in spinîs
column3: et in nómine Dòmini qŭia ultus sùm in eos. ^ They surrounded me like bees
column4: and they burned like fire among thorns
column5: and in the name of the Lord I was revenged on them.

column2: et Dòminus suscépit me. ^ Being pushed I was overturned that I might fall
column3: but the Lord supported me.

column1: 14 ^ Fortitúdo mea et laŭs mea Dòminus
column2: et factus èst mìhi in salútem. ^ The Lord is my strength and my praise
column3: and he is become my salvation.

column1: 15 ^ Vox exsultatiónis et salútis in tabernáculîs justórum. dèxtera Dòmini fecit virtútem. ^ The voice of rejoicing and of salvation is in the tabernacles of the just. The right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength.
16 ^ dèxtera Dòmini exaltávit me~; dèxtera Dòmini fecit virtútem. ^ The right hand of the Lord hath exalted me~; the right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength.

column2: sed vivem
column3: et narrábo ópera Dòmini. ^ I shall not die
column5: and shall declare the works of the Lord.

column2: et morti non trádidit me. ^ The Lord chastising hath chastised me
column3: but he hath not delivered me over to death.

column1: 19 ^ Aperíte mìhi portas justìtiaĕ~; ingrèssus in eas confitébor Dòmino. ^ Open ye to me the gates of justice~; having entered into to them I will give praise to the Lord.
20 ^ Haĕc porta Dòmini~; justi intrábunt in eam. ^ This is the gate of the Lord~; the just shall enter into it.

column2: et factus ès mìhi in salútem. ^ I will give glory to thee because thou hast heard me
column3: and art become my salvation.

column2: hic factus èst in caput ánguli. ^ The stone which the builders rejected~; this is become the head of the corner.
et èst mirábile in òculîs nostrîs. ^ This is the Lord's doing
column3: and it is wonderful in our eyes.

column1: 24 ^ Haĕc èst dies qŭam fecit Dòminus~; exsultémus
column2: et laĕtémur in ea. ^ This is the day which the Lord hath made~; let us be glad and rejoice therein.
salvum me fac. O Dòmine
column3: bène prosperáre. ^ O Lord

column1: 26 ^ Benedìctus qŭi vênit in nómine Dòmini. Benedíximus vobîs de domu Dòmini. ^ Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord. We have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

column2: et illúxit nobîs. Constitúite diem solèmnem in condènsîs
column3: usqŭe ad cornu altáris. ^ The Lord is God
column4: and he hath shone upon us. Appoint a solemn day with shady boughs
column5: even to the horn of the altar.

column2: et confitébor tìbi~; Deus meus ès tu
column3: et exaltábo te. Confitébor tìbi qŭóniam exaŭdivìsti me
column4: et factus ès mìhi in salútem. ^ Thou art my God
column5: and I will praise thee~; thou art my God
column6: and I will exalt thee. I will praise thee because thou hast heard me

column2: qŭóniam bonus
column3: qŭóniam in sáĕculum misericórdia ejus. ^ O praise ye the Lord
column5: for his mercy endureth for ever.
